Lists values that specify the interaction mode for the keyboard and cursor.
This tool is used for navigation. The end-user can browse the document by moving the mouse while pressing the left button.

This tool is used to change the zoom level and navigate in a document. The end-user can increase the zoom level by simply clicking, decrease the zoom level by clicking while pressing the Ctrl key, or zoom in on a portion of a page by dragging the rectangle around it.
This tool is used for navigation in a document. You can also select text and images in a document to copy using a keyboard and mouse.
A method that will handle the event.

member.name: M:DevExpress.Xpf.PdfViewer.FormFieldValueChangedEventHandler.Invoke(System.Windows.DependencyObject,DevExpress.Xpf.PdfViewer.FormFieldValueChangedEventArgs)

summary.para: A method that will handle the event.

member.param: The event source.
A object that contains data related to the event.

summary.para: Lists values that specify the layout of the navigation panels.

Navigation panels are positioned above the document window. Moving the cursor away from the navigation panel will cause it to collapse. Clicking on the panel button will expand the navigation panel without sliding.
This mode is similar to DockPanel.
Navigation panels are placed in the PDF Viewer without overlapping the document window.

summary.para: Lists values that specify the panel style of the attachments viewer.

The attachments panel is positioned above the document window. Moving the cursor away from the panel will cause it to collapse. Clicking on the panel button will expand the attachments panel without sliding.
This mode is similar to DockPanel.
The attachments panel is placed in the PDF Viewer without overlapping the document window.
